public ref class SafeHandle abstract : System::Runtime::ConstrainedExecution::CriticalFinalizerObject, IDisposable

summary.span: 表示操作系统句柄的包装类。

span.span: Represents a wrapper class for operating system handles.
This class must be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类提供了关键终结句柄资源，防止句柄从被过早地通过垃圾回收回收和 Windows 以引用非预期的非托管的对象进行更新。The class provides critical finalization of handle resources, preventing handles from being reclaimed prematurely by garbage collection and from being recycled by Windows to reference unintended unmanaged objects. 本主题包括以下部分：This topic includes the following sections: [为什么 SafeHandle？](#Why) [Why SafeHandle?](#Why) [SafeHandle 的用途](#Does) [What SafeHandle does](#Does) [从 SafeHandle 派生的类Classes derived from SafeHandle](#Derived) ## 为什么 SafeHandle？Why SafeHandle? .NET Framework 版本 2.0 中，所有操作系统句柄可能仅封装在之前托管包装器对象。Before the .NET Framework version 2.0, all operating system handles could only be encapsulated in the managed wrapper object. 虽然这样可以方便地与本机代码进行互操作，可以使用异步异常，如线程意外中止或堆栈溢出将句柄会泄漏。While this was a convenient way to interoperate with native code, handles could be leaked by asynchronous exceptions, such as a thread aborting unexpectedly or a stack overflow. 这些异步异常会阻碍清理操作系统资源，它们可以在应用中几乎任何地方发生。These asynchronous exceptions are an obstacle to cleaning up operating system resources, and they can occur almost anywhere in your app. 尽管替代应用于方法允许的非托管资源清理时对象正在进行垃圾回收，在某些情况下，可以通过执行在平台中的方法时的垃圾回收回收可终结对象调用调用。Although overrides to the method allow cleanup of unmanaged resources when an object is being garbage collected, in some circumstances, finalizable objects can be reclaimed by garbage collection while executing a method within a platform invoke call. 如果终结器释放句柄传递到该平台 invoke 调用，它可能会导致处理损坏。If a finalizer frees the handle passed to that platform invoke call, it could lead to handle corruption. 此外会回收句柄，而您的方法在一个平台，期间将无法调用，如读取文件时。The handle could also be reclaimed while your method is blocked during a platform invoke call, such as while reading a file. 更严重的是，因为 Windows 积极回收句柄，句柄无法被回收并指向可能包含敏感数据的另一个资源。More critically, because Windows aggressively recycles handles, a handle could be recycled and point to another resource that might contain sensitive data. 这被称为回收攻击可以会损坏数据和安全威胁。This is known as a recycle attack and can potentially corrupt data and be a security threat. ## SafeHandle 的用途What SafeHandle does 类简化了多个这些对象生存期问题，并与平台集成调用，以便避免泄露操作系统资源。The class simplifies several of these object lifetime issues, and is integrated with platform invoke so that operating system resources are not leaked. 类通过分配和释放句柄而不发生中断来解析对象生存期问题。The class resolves object lifetime issues by assigning and releasing handles without interruption. 它包含的重要终结器，以确保句柄已关闭，并且保证在运行期间意外卸载，即使在平台 invoke 调用的情况下被假定为处于损坏状态。It contains a critical finalizer that ensures that the handle is closed and is guaranteed to run during unexpected unloads, even in cases when the platform invoke call is assumed to be in a corrupted state. 因为继承，先于任何关键终结器被调用的非关键终结器。Because inherits from , all the noncritical finalizers are called before any of the critical finalizers. 在相同的垃圾回收传递期间不再是实时的对象调用终结器。The finalizers are called on objects that are no longer live during the same garbage collection pass. 例如，对象可以运行正常的终结器，若要刷新现有缓冲数据没有被泄漏或回收的句柄的风险。For example, a object can run a normal finalizer to flush out existing buffered data without the risk of the handle being leaked or recycled. 关键和非关键终结器之间这一弱顺序不适用于常规使用。This very weak ordering between critical and noncritical finalizers is not intended for general use. 存在主要是为了帮助中的现有库迁移这些库，从而使用而无需更改它们的语义。It exists primarily to assist in the migration of existing libraries by allowing those libraries to use without altering their semantics. 此外，关键终结器以及任何调用，如方法，必须在受约束的执行区域。Additionally, the critical finalizer and anything it calls, such as the method, must be in a constrained execution region. 这对实施约束的终结器调用关系图中可以编写什么代码。This imposes constraints on what code can be written within the finalizer's call graph. 平台调用操作自动递增引用计数的句柄由封装和完成后对其进行增减。Platform invoke operations automatically increment the reference count of handles encapsulated by a and decrement them upon completion. 这可确保，不会回收或意外关闭句柄。This ensures that the handle will not be recycled or closed unexpectedly. 构造时，可以指定基础句柄的所有权按值提供给对象`ownsHandle`中的参数类构造函数。You can specify ownership of the underlying handle when constructing objects by supplying a value to the `ownsHandle` argument in the class constructor. 此设置控制是否对象已释放对象后将释放该句柄。This controls whether the object will release the handle after the object has been disposed. 这是对于具有特殊生存期要求的句柄，或者使用由其他人控制其生存期的句柄。This is useful for handles with peculiar lifetime requirements or for consuming a handle whose lifetime is controlled by someone else. ## 从 SafeHandle 派生的类Classes derived from SafeHandle 是操作系统句柄的抽象的包装器类。 is an abstract wrapper class for operating system handles. 从此类派生比较困难。Deriving from this class is difficult. 但可以使用 命名空间中可提供以下项的安全句柄的派生类。Instead, use the derived classes in the namespace that provide safe handles for the following: - 文件 (类)。Files (the class). - 内存映射文件 (类)。Memory mapped files (the class). - 管道 (类)。Pipes (the class). - 内存视图 (类)。Memory views (the class). - 加密结构 ( ， ， ，和类)。Cryptography constructs (the , , , and classes). - 进程 (类)。Processes (the class). - 注册表项 (类)。Registry keys (the class). - 等待句柄 (类)。Wait handles (the class). ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建一个自定义安全句柄的操作系统文件句柄，派生自。The following code example creates a custom safe handle for an operating system file handle, deriving from . 它从文件读取的字节，并显示其十六进制值。It reads bytes from a file and displays their hexadecimal values. 它还包含一个错误测试工具，使线程中止，但释放句柄值。It also contains a fault testing harness that causes the thread to abort, but the handle value is freed. 当使用表示句柄，句柄有时泄漏由于异步线程中止。When using an to represent handles, the handle is occasionally leaked due to the asynchronous thread abort. 你将需要与编译的应用程序相同的文件夹中的文本文件。You will need a text file in the same folder as the compiled application. 假设您将该应用程序"HexViewer"，命令行用法是：Assuming that you name the application "HexViewer", the command line usage is: `HexViewer -Fault` （可选） 指定`-Fault`有意尝试通过中止某个窗口中的线程泄漏句柄。Optionally specify `-Fault` to intentionally attempt to leak the handle by aborting the thread in a certain window. 使用 Windows Perfmon.exe 工具来监视时将故障注入的句柄计数。Use the Windows Perfmon.exe tool to monitor handle counts while injecting faults. [!code-csharp[SafeHandle#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/SafeHandle/CS/program.cs#1)]

para.span: 若要创建派生自的类，您必须知道如何创建和释放操作系统句柄。

span.span: To create a class derived from , you must know how to create and free an operating system handle.

para.span: 此过程是不同的类型不同的句柄，因为一些使用[CloseHandle](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms724211.aspx)函数，而其他人使用更具体的函数，例如[UnmapViewOfFile](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/aa366882.aspx)或[FindClose](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/aa364413.aspx).

span.span: This process is different for different handle types because some use the [CloseHandle](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms724211.aspx) function, while others use more specific functions such as [UnmapViewOfFile](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/aa366882.aspx) or [FindClose](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/aa364413.aspx).

para.span: 出于此原因，必须创建的派生的类你想要在安全句柄中包装每个操作系统句柄类型。

span.span: For this reason, you must create a derived class of for each operating system handle type that you want to wrap in a safe handle.

para.span: 当从 继承时，必须重写下面的成员： 和 。

span.span: When you inherit from , you must override the following members: and .

para.span: 您还应提供调用基构造函数提供一个值，表示无效句柄的值，该值的默认构造函数和一个值，该值指示是否由拥有的本机句柄，因此应释放时已被释放。

span.span: You should also provide a default constructor that calls the base constructor with a value that represent an invalid handle value, and a value indicating whether the native handle is owned by the and consequently should be freed when that has been disposed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果`ownsHandle`参数是`false`，永远不会调用; 因此，不建议使用此参数值，因为你的代码可能会泄漏资源。If the `ownsHandle` parameter is `false`, is never called; thus, it is not recommended to use this parameter value as your code may leak resources.

exception.span: 派生类驻留在不具备非托管代码访问权限的程序集中。

span.span: The derived class resides in an assembly without unmanaged code access permission.

summary.span: 标记句柄，以便释放资源。

span.span: Marks the handle for releasing and freeing resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用或方法允许要释放的资源。Calling the or method allows the resources to be freed. 这如果其他线程正在使用的相同的安全句柄对象时可能不会立即发生，但不再是这种情况时，就立即将发生这种情况。This might not happen immediately if other threads are using the same safe handle object, but will happen as soon as that is no longer the case. 尽管大多数类使用类不需要提供一个终结器，这有时很有必要 （例如，清空文件缓冲区或编写某些数据回发到内存中）。Although most classes that use the class do not need to provide a finalizer, this is sometimes necessary (for example, to flush out file buffers or to write some data back into memory). 在这种情况下，类可以提供了终结器，保证在运行之前关键终结器运行。In this case, the class can provide a finalizer that is guaranteed to run before the critical finalizer runs. 调用或方法完成后使用对象。Call the or method when you are finished using the object. > [!NOTE] > 始终调用或发布到最后一个引用之前对象。Always call or before you release your last reference to the object. 否则，在垃圾回收器调用 对象的 方法之前，该对象正在使用的资源不会被释放。Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the object's method.

permission.span: 若要调用非托管的代码的权限。

span.span: for permission to call unmanaged code.
Security action: .
Associated enumeration:

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void DangerousAddRef(bool& success) cil managed
Public Sub DangerousAddRef (ByRef success As Boolean)

param.name: success
param.span: 如果成功递增引用计数器，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the reference counter was successfully incremented; otherwise, .

summary.span: 手动递增 实例中的引用计数器。

span.span: Manually increments the reference counter on instances.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法会阻止公共语言运行时回收使用一个句柄的内存 (当运行时调用方法)。The method prevents the common language runtime from reclaiming memory used by a handle (which occurs when the runtime calls the method). 可以使用此方法手动递增的引用计数实例。You can use this method to manually increment the reference count on a instance. 返回布尔值使用`ref`参数 (`success`)，该值指示是否已成功递增引用计数。 returns a Boolean value using a `ref` parameter (`success`) that indicates whether the reference count was incremented successfully. 这允许回退发生故障时应用程序逻辑。This allows your program logic to back out in case of failure. 应设置`success`到`false`然后才能调用。You should set `success` to `false` before calling . 如果`success`是`true`，通过匹配对的调用来避免资源泄漏与相应地调用。If `success` is `true`, avoid resource leaks by matching the call to with a corresponding call to . > [!CAUTION] > 此方法适用于高级用户，并始终必须谨慎使用。This method is intended for advanced users and must always be used carefully. 若要避免泄露句柄资源，始终内线程中止不会中断处理受约束的执行区域 (CER) 调用此方法。To avoid leaking handle resources, always call this method inside a constrained execution region (CER), where a thread abort cannot interrupt processing.

permission.span: 若要调用非托管的代码的权限。

span.span: for permission to call unmanaged code.
Security action: .
Associated enumeration:

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance native int DangerousGetHandle() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline across NGen image boundaries")

span.span: Returns the value of the field.
An representing the value of the field.

returns.span: 如果句柄已使用 标记为无效，此方法仍返回原来的句柄值，该值可能已失效。

span.span: If the handle has been marked invalid with , this method still returns the original handle value, which can be a stale value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以使用此方法检索的实例的实际句柄值派生的类。You can use this method to retrieve the actual handle value from an instance of the derived class. 此方法是所需的向后兼容性因为.NET Framework 中的许多属性返回`IntPtr`处理类型。This method is needed for backwards compatibility because many properties in the .NET Framework return `IntPtr` handle types. `IntPtr` 句柄类型是用来表示指针或句柄的特定于平台的类型。`IntPtr` handle types are platform-specific types used to represent a pointer or a handle. > [!CAUTION] > 使用方法会造成安全风险，因为，如果该句柄已被标记为无效与，仍然会返回原始的、 可能失效的句柄值。Using the method can pose security risks because, if the handle has been marked as invalid with , still returns the original, potentially stale handle value. 返回的句柄也可以是任何时候回收。The returned handle can also be recycled at any point. 充其量，这意味着该句柄可能突然停止工作。At best, this means the handle might suddenly stop working. 最坏的情形，如果向不受信任代码公开句柄或句柄表示的资源，这可能导致重复使用或返回句柄回收安全攻击。At worst, if the handle or the resource that the handle represents is exposed to untrusted code, this can lead to a recycling security attack on the reused or returned handle. 例如，不受信任调用方可以查询返回的只是句柄上的数据并接收为完全不相关的资源的信息。For example, an untrusted caller can query data on the handle just returned and receive information for an entirely unrelated resource. 请参阅并详细了解使用方法方法。See the and the methods for more information about using the methodsafely.

permission.span: 若要调用非托管的代码的权限。

span.span: for permission to call unmanaged code.

span.span: Manually decrements the reference counter on a instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法是对的对应。The method is the counterpart to . 应始终与调用方法通过成功调用。You should always match a call to the method with a successful call to . > [!CAUTION] > 此方法适用于高级用户，并始终必须谨慎使用。This method is intended for advanced users and must always be used carefully. 若要避免泄露句柄资源，始终内线程中止不会中断处理受约束的执行区域 (CER) 调用此方法。To avoid leaking handle resources, always call this method inside a constrained execution region (CER), where a thread abort cannot interrupt processing. 同样，仅在调用可能会导致资源泄漏，调用可能会导致无效的句柄状态变得可见的其他线程。In the same way that unmatched calls can cause resource leaks, unmatched calls can cause invalid handle states to become visible to other threads. 不会公开或对不受信任代码的调用。Do not expose or calls to untrusted code.

summary.span: 释放 类使用的资源。

span.span: Releases the resources used by the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed
abstract member Dispose : unit -> unit override this.Dispose : unit -> unit

summary.span: 释放 类使用的所有资源。

span.span: Releases all resources used by the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用或方法允许要释放的资源。Calling the or method allows the resources to be freed. 这如果其他线程正在使用安全句柄，在同一个实例时可能不会立即发生，但不再是这种情况时，就立即将发生这种情况。This might not happen immediately if other threads are using the same instance of the safe handle, but will happen as soon as that is no longer the case. 尽管大多数类使用不需要提供终结器，这有时很有必要 （例如，若要清空文件缓冲区，或若要将一些数据写回到内存）。Although most classes using do not need to provide a finalizer, this is sometimes necessary (for example, to flush out file buffers or to write some data back into memory). 在这种情况下，它们可以提供了终结器，保证在运行之前关键终结器运行。In this case, they can provide a finalizer that is guaranteed to run before the critical finalizer runs. 调用或方法完成后使用对象。Call the or method when you are finished using the object. 方法使中不可用状态的对象。The method leaves the object in an unusable state. > [!NOTE] > 始终调用或方法在发布到最后一个引用前对象。Always call the or method before you release your last reference to the object. 否则，在垃圾回收器调用 对象的 方法之前，该对象正在使用的资源不会被释放。Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the object's method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法返回一个值，该值指示是否对象的句柄将不再与本机资源关联。The method returns a value indicating whether the object's handle is no longer associated with a native resource. 这不同于定义属性，用于计算是否给定句柄将始终被视为无效。This differs from the definition of the property, which computes whether a given handle is always considered invalid. 方法将返回`true`在以下情况下的值：The method returns a `true` value in the following cases: - 调用方法。The method was called. - 方法或调用方法并不没有为任何引用其他线程上的对象。The method or method was called and there are no references to the object on other threads.

value.span: 如果句柄值无效，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the handle value is invalid; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 派生的类必须实现属性，以便公共语言运行时能够确定是否需要关键完成。Derived classes must implement the property so that the common language runtime can determine whether critical finalization is required. 派生的类必须提供适合它们支持的句柄的常规类型的实现 （0 或-1 是无效的）。Derived classes must provide an implementation that suits the general type of handle they support (0 or -1 is invalid). 这些类可以再进一步派生特定的安全句柄类型。These classes can then be further derived for specific safe handle types. 与不同属性，用于报告是否对象已完成使用基础句柄，属性计算是否给定句柄值将始终被视为无效。Unlike the property, which reports whether the object has finished using the underlying handle, the property calculates whether the given handle value is always considered invalid. 因此，属性始终返回相同的值的任何一个句柄值。Therefore, the property always returns the same value for any one handle value. ## Examples 以下示例检查已成功打开一个文件。The following example checks if a file was opened successfully. 此代码示例是为提供一个更大示例的一部分类。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. [!code-csharp[SafeHandle#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/SafeHandle/CS/program.cs#2)]

permission.span: 若要调用非托管的代码的权限。

span.span: for permission to call unmanaged code.
Security action: .
Associated enumeration:

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool ReleaseHandle() cil managed
Protected MustOverride Function ReleaseHandle () As Boolean

summary.span: 如果在派生类中重写，执行释放句柄所需的代码。

span.span: When overridden in a derived class, executes the code required to free the handle.

returns.span: 如果句柄释放成功，则为 ；如果出现灾难性故障，则为 。

span.span: if the handle is released successfully; otherwise, in the event of a catastrophic failure, .

returns.span: 在这种情况下，它会生成 releaseHandleFailed 托管调试助手。

span.span: In this case, it generates a releaseHandleFailed Managed Debugging Assistant.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法保证将仅一次且仅当该句柄已定义的有效调用属性。The method is guaranteed to be called only once and only if the handle is valid as defined by the property. 实现此方法在你派生类，以执行释放句柄所需的任何代码。Implement this method in your derived classes to execute any code that is required to free the handle. 因为的函数之一是要保证防止资源泄漏中的实现代码必须永远不会失败。Because one of the functions of is to guarantee prevention of resource leaks, the code in your implementation of must never fail. 垃圾回收器调用正常的终结器已运行了垃圾回收在同一时间的对象之后。The garbage collector calls after normal finalizers have been run for objects that were garbage collected at the same time. 垃圾回收器保证调用此方法的资源，并且，该方法不会中断时它正在进行。The garbage collector guarantees the resources to invoke this method and that the method will not be interrupted while it is in progress. 此方法将准备作为受约束的执行区域 (CER) 中，在实例构造时 （以及其静态确定的调用关系图中的所有方法） 中。This method will be prepared as a constrained execution region (CER) at instance construction time (along with all the methods in its statically determinable call graph). 尽管这可防止线程中止中断，你仍必须小心以免引入中被重写任何错误路径方法。Although this prevents thread abort interrupts, you must still be careful not to introduce any fault paths in your overridden method. 具体而言，适用属性从调用任何方法为。In particular, apply the attribute to any methods you call from . 在大多数情况下应为此代码：In most cases this code should be: `ReliabilityContract(Consistency.WillNotCorruptState, Cer.Success)` 此外，对于简单的清理 (例如，调用 Win32 API`CloseHandle`上的文件句柄) 的单一平台调用中，可以检查返回值。Additionally, for simple cleanup (for example, calling the Win32 API `CloseHandle` on a file handle) you can check the return value for the single platform invoke call. 对于复杂清理，可能有大量程序逻辑和很多方法调用，其中一些可能会失败。For complex cleanup, you may have a lot of program logic and many method calls, some of which might fail. 您必须确保应用程序逻辑的这种情况下每个具有回退的代码。You must ensure that your program logic has fallback code for each of those cases. 如果将返回`false`出于任何原因，它将生成[releaseHandleFailed](~/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/releasehandlefailed-mda.md)托管调试助手。If returns `false` for any reason, it generates a [releaseHandleFailed](~/docs/framework/debug-trace-profile/releasehandlefailed-mda.md) Managed Debugging Assistant. 这可帮助你检测尝试释放资源无法正常工作的情况。This helps you detect cases where your attempt to release resources fails. ## Examples 下面的代码示例释放句柄，并且是为提供一个更大示例的一部分类。The following code example releases the handle and is part of a larger example provided for the class. [!code-csharp[SafeHandle#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/SafeHandle/CS/program.cs#3)]

param.name: handle
param.span: 要使用的预先存在的句柄。

span.span: The pre-existing handle to use.

summary.span: 将句柄设置为预先存在的指定句柄。

span.span: Sets the handle to the specified pre-existing handle.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用方法仅在需要以支持预先存在的句柄 （例如，如果在结构中返回的句柄），因为.NET Framework COM 互操作基础结构不支持封送处理输出的结构中的句柄。Use the method only if you need to support a pre-existing handle (for example, if the handle is returned in a structure) because the .NET Framework COM interop infrastructure does not support marshaling output handles in a structure.

permission.span: 若要调用非托管的代码的权限。

Associated enumeration:

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetHandleAsInvalid() cil managed

summary.span: 将句柄标记为不再使用。

span.span: Marks a handle as no longer used.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用方法仅当您知道您的网名不再引用的资源时。Call the method only when you know that your handle no longer references a resource. 执行此操作不会更改的值字段; 它仅标记句柄为已关闭。Doing so does not change the value of the field; it only marks the handle as closed. 然后，句柄可能包含可能已失效。The handle might then contain a potentially stale value. 此调用的效果是不进行任何尝试释放资源。The effect of this call is that no attempt is made to free the resources. 如同方法，请使用仅当你需要支持预先存在的句柄。As with the method, use only if you need to support a pre-existing handle.
